clinical_study.brief_title: BABYDIET-Study - Primary Prevention of Type 1 Diabetes in Relatives at Increased Genetic Risk
clinical_study.official_title: BABYDIET-Study - Primary Prevention of Type 1 Diabetes in Relatives at Increased Genetic Risk

brief_summary.textblock: The major goals of this project are to determine whether primary intervention through delayed introduction of dietary gluten is feasible and could reduce the incidence of islet autoimmunity in high-risk first degree relatives of patients with type 1 diabetes.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of dietary intervention on the development of islet autoantibodies
primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome is to compare the prevalence of iselt autoantibodies between children participating in the dietary intervention and the control group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of dietary intervention on the development of Type 1 diabetes.
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary outcome is to compare the prevalence of type 1 diabetes between children participating in the dietary intervention and the control group

arm_group.description: Glutenfree diet during the first year of life

intervention.intervention_name: Glutenfree diet during the first year of life
intervention.description: Glutenfree diet during the first year of life

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Newborn offspring or siblings of patients with type 1 diabetes with a HLA genotype conferring a high diabetes risk
Exclusion Criteria:
- If infants have an illness or birth defect that precludes long-term follow-up or involves use of treatment that may alter the natural history of diabetes
